items.title: Diane Wilson Takes on Another Plastics Plant in Texas
items.description: Diane Wilson, the prominent Gulf Coast environmentalist, filed a legal notice of intent on Wednesday to sue Dow for alleged large-scale discharges of plastic pellets from its 4,700-acre petrochemical complex outside Seadrift, Texas.  Wilson, a 77-year-old former shrimper from Seadrift, sued another Gulf Coast petrochemical giant, Formosa Plastics, and ultimately won a landmark settlement in […]

items.title: The Texas Power Grid Will Get a Boost from Batteries This Winter
items.description: Even with less available electric power capacity during cold weather in Texas, battery storage systems are reducing the risk of power outages this winter, the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) reported at its December board of directors meeting.
